items.title: GeForce Garage - Summer of RTX Community Build

ai.summary: Based on the available description, GeForce Garage highlights the winner of the Summer of RTX r/buildapc Community Build Contest, u/JeffersonPutnam, featuring a small-form-factor GeForce RTX 5090 rig. The video description lists the full parts list (with a PCPartPicker link), the build host, and links to GeForce social channels.
bullets: Winner: u/JeffersonPutnam — Summer of RTX community build contest.
Chassis: Fractal Design Era 2; GPU: GeForce RTX 5090 Founders Edition.
Core components: MSI MPG B850I Edge mobo, Ryzen 7 9800X3D CPU, 32GB Teamgroup DDR5-6000.
Power and cooling: Corsair SF1000 SFX PSU and Corsair Nautilus 240 RS AIO.
PCPartPicker parts list linked and GeForce host credited (Dwight).
takeaways: Demonstrates deployment of a flagship RTX 5090 in a small-form-factor chassis—implications for high-performance workstation density.
Linked PCPartPicker parts list provides a repeatable BOM useful for procurement and cost-estimation.
Specification of an SFX 1000W PSU and AIO cooling highlights power and thermal requirements for compact, high-end GPU builds.
Shows community-driven interest in high-performance desktop configurations that may inform workstation configuration choices.

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy GenAI solutions on Google Cloud, using the platform’s infrastructure to streamline operations and boost developer productivity. The engagement compressed TTEC’s digital transformation timeline and helped unlock new revenue streams, expanding what the company views as possible for its business.
bullets: TTEC worked with Google Cloud Consulting to accelerate AI solution prototyping and deployment.
They leveraged GenAI capabilities and Google Cloud’s infrastructure to streamline operations.
Developer productivity was boosted through the adopted solutions and tooling.
The partnership compressed TTEC’s digital transformation timeline.
New revenue streams were unlocked as a result of the AI deployment and expanded ambitions.
takeaways: Cloud infrastructure can support rapid GenAI prototyping and deployment to speed transformation efforts.
Partnering with cloud consulting can compress timelines for digital transformation and scale ambitions.
GenAI initiatives can directly boost developer productivity, influencing staffing and tooling decisions.
AI deployments have the potential to create new revenue streams, so align strategy and investment accordingly.
